dt: {bc}the process of understanding something perceived in terms of previous experience

et: French {it}aperception{/it}, from {it}apercevoir{/it}, from Middle French {it}aperceivre{/it}, from {it}a-{/it} (from Latin {it}ad-{/it}) + {it}perceivre{/it} to perceive
shortdef: mental perception; especially : the process of understanding something perceived in terms of previous experience

dt: {bc}a projective technique that is widely used in clinical psychology to make personality, psychodynamic, and diagnostic assessments based on the subject's verbal responses to a series of black-and-white pictures

shortdef: a projective technique that is widely used in clinical psychology to make personality, psychodynamic, and diagnostic assessments based on the subject's verbal responses to a series of black-and-white pictures
